attributes.action: Charge income tax per family unit rather than per individual
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I propose that calculating income tax based upon the total family (parental) income, rather than the income of each individual, is a far fairer way of taxing single income families.

Under the current structure one family with two parents earning up to £33,300 per year each can achieve a total family income of £66,600 per year at the 22% tax rate. However, another family with one single income (perhaps a single parent family, or where one parent has chosen to stay at home to look after children) can only achieve an income of £33,300 per year before being taxed the higher rate of 40%. The single income family therefore receive a significantly higher tax burden than the two income family for an equivalent gross income. 

Please consider making increased allowance for families with one single income.
